Posts.Content: SukiK wrote: I have three little microcalcifications that are linear. I also have scattered microcalcifications that are scattered and random. I'm going to the Mayo Clinic to meet with a surgeon. I'm scared to death. I'm scared of the biopsy, scared of the diagnosis, and scared of the treatment! Have you had linear microcalifications? What did it turn out to be? Was the biopsy painful? Thank you! Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Linear Microcalcifications - Help! I'm Scared! SukiK leaf

Posts.Content: Jan 16, 2016 05:01PM SukiK wrote: That is great news, LillySprings!! No, this isn't my first mammogram. I'm 64! I just found out my 2014 mammogram showed the same calcifications and I was not called back for any diagnostic ones. I think I fell through the cracks. So I've had these tiny linear microcalcifications for two years.

Posts.Content: Jan 19, 2016 02:02PM SukiK wrote: I went to a mayo Clinic yesterday. The surgeon oncologist called the microcalcifications a cluster. Biopsy is on Monday. I'm really scared.

Posts.Content: Jan 26, 2016 01:22PM SukiK wrote: I had the biopsy. It was pretty painless. Even the numbing shot didn't really hurt. Results in 24 to 48 hours. I am so worried, although the radiologist at Mayo said that if it is can we, it's early.
